interface.name: org.chromium.Buffet.Manager
interface.tp:docstring: The Manager is responsible for global state of Buffet. It exposes interfaces which affect the entire device such as device registration and device state.

property.name: Status
property.tp:docstring:
State of Buffet's cloud registration. Possible values include: "unconfigured": Buffet has no credentials, either from an out of box state, or because device was unregistered.
"connecting": Buffet is registered and attempting to connect to the cloud.
"connected": Buffet is online and connected to the cloud. Note that only this state requires internet connectivity.
"invalid_credentials": Buffet has credentials, but they are no longer valid.

property.name: DeviceId
property.tp:docstring: GCD ID if the device is registered or empty otherwise.

property.name: State
property.tp:docstring: JSON with state of the devices.

property.name: ModelId
property.tp:docstring: Five character code assigned by the cloud registry of device models.

property.name: Name
property.tp:docstring: Human readable name of the device. Must not be empty.

property.name: Description
property.tp:docstring: Human readable description of the device.

property.name: GCDBootstrapState
property.tp:docstring:
Contains one of the following values describing the state of GCD bootstrapping: “disabled” - GCD registration has been disabled in the config file. “offline” - GCD registration is unknown because the device is offline. “connecting” - GCD registration is unknown because the device is still connecting to the cloud. “waiting” - Waiting to be configured with GCD credentials. “registering” - Registering the device with the GCD servers. “online” - Device is online and registered with GCD servers.
Note: more values may be added later to this list.
Clients that wish to present a single linear bootstrapping flow to users may treat GCD bootstrapping states as a suffix to WiFi bootstrapping states. If we have no cloud connectivity, we cannot possibly do GCD registration/credential verification.

property.name: PairingInfo
property.tp:docstring: Describes the state of device pairing. While no pairing attempt is in progress, this dictionary will be empty. When a client initiates a pairing transaction via /privet/v3/pairing/start, dictionary will contain the following keys: “sessionId” - ID of the pairing session; generated by device “pairingMode” - Selected type of pairing from /privet/v3/pairing/start (e.g. “pinCode” or “embeddedCode”) “code” - The pin code or embedded code as appropriate to the “pairingMode” value. See design document. This value will be a string.
